body.p: The third issue is how an entity that receives goods or services from its suppliers (including employees) should account for share‑based arrangements that are cash‑settled when the entity itself does not have any obligation to make the required payments to its suppliers. For example, consider the following arrangements in which the parent (not the entity itself) has an obligation to make the required cash payments to the employees of the entity:

li.p: the employees of the entity will receive cash payments that are linked to the price of its equity instruments.
the employees of the entity will receive cash payments that are linked to the price of its parent’s equity instruments.
